questions.question: What was the problem the science squad faced in Porpoises in Peril?

choices.answer: The science squad didn't know what to do.

questions.question: The porpoises food supply was contaminated by the underwater mine. What does contaminated mean?
What does the word population mean in Porpoises in Peril?
What key words does the author use on Page 7 to show that the porpoises are in danger?
From whose point of view is Porpoises in Peril told?
In Chapter 3, the science squad tries to gather information by doing what?

choices.answer: talking to the local people and analyzing the water
meeting with Professor Vloodman and the local police
swimming with the porpoises and analyzing the water
taking notes and studying the porpoises

questions.question: In chapter 4, what important discoveries does the team make when they meet in Jada's room?

choices.answer: the porpoises were poisoned by a coral reef
Drake Darkly was an illegal jewel miner
Kate had pictures of the underwater mine
Jada found the briefcase with DDJ on the side

questions.question: What does the word tunnel-like refer to on page 42?

choices.answer: the ladder on the boat that the team was on
the jewels that Kate found in the mine
the entrance to the mining equipment

questions.question: On page 12, Jada says that it is time to formulate a plan. What does formulate mean?
What do the visuals on pages 46 and 47 help you understand about the story?

choices.answer: Kate's mission to the mine was a success
The science squad did not save the porpoises
Jada and Professor Q had a meeting to help the porpoises
The science squad celebrated their success
